stem:
The nurse is caring for a client at 39 weeks gestation who is in active labor. Complete the following sentences by dragging from the choices below. 

During the active phase of labor, contractions typically occur every [__________] minutes and last for [__________] seconds. The expected cervical dilation during this phase is [__________] cm.

itemContext.sbar: 14:00, Situation: Maria Rodriguez, 28-year-old female, G1P0 at 39 weeks gestation, admitted for active labor. Background: Patient reports regular contractions started approximately 2 hours ago. She denies any complications during pregnancy. Assessment: Vital signs are stable: BP 120/80 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, RR 18, Temp 37.0°C. Fetal heart rate (FHR) is 140 bpm with moderate variability. Cervical exam reveals 4 cm dilation, 80% effacement. Patient reports pain level of 7/10. Recommendation: Continue to monitor maternal and fetal status. Consider pain management options per patient preference and provider orders. Anticipate further cervical dilation and descent of the fetus.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content: 14:00, Situation: Maria Rodriguez, 28-year-old female, G1P0 at 39 weeks gestation, admitted for active labor. Background: Patient reports regular contractions started approximately 2 hours ago. She denies any complications during pregnancy. Assessment: Vital signs are stable: BP 120/80 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, RR 18, Temp 37.0°C. Fetal heart rate (FHR) is 140 bpm with moderate variability. Cervical exam reveals 4 cm dilation, 80% effacement. Patient reports pain level of 7/10. Recommendation: Continue to monitor maternal and fetal status. Consider pain management options per patient preference and provider orders. Anticipate further cervical dilation and descent of the fetus.

tabs.title: Vitals
tabs.content:
BP: 120/80 mmHg
HR: 88 bpm
RR: 18
Temp: 37.0°C
FHR: 140 bpm

tabs.title: Radiology
tabs.content: No radiology orders at this time.

tabs.title: MAR
tabs.content: No medications administered at this time.

rationale.correct: During the active phase of labor, contractions typically occur every 3-5 minutes and last for 45-60 seconds. The expected cervical dilation during this phase is 4-7 cm. This reflects the typical progression of labor and expected parameters during the active phase.
rationale.incorrect: Incorrect answers reflect a misunderstanding of the typical parameters of the active phase of labor. Contraction frequency, duration, and cervical dilation are key indicators of labor progress and are essential for appropriate nursing management.
clinicalPearls: Active labor is characterized by regular, painful contractions that lead to progressive cervical dilation and effacement.
Monitoring contraction frequency, duration, and intensity is crucial for assessing labor progress and identifying potential complications.
Cervical dilation is measured in centimeters and provides valuable information about the stage of labor.
The active phase typically begins around 4 cm dilation and progresses more rapidly than the latent phase.
rationale.questionTrap: Students may confuse the parameters of the latent phase of labor with the active phase. The latent phase has less frequent and shorter contractions with slower cervical dilation. Also, students may not remember the expected cervical dilation during active labor.
